cell.text: Name
Location
Origin
Fate
Notes
Indigenous peoples of the Americas
The whole of North America

cell.html: Native Americans in the United States and the First Nations of Canada had established varying levels of governmental organization before contact with Europeans; in many cases, these were equivalent to contemporary European levels of government organization.
cell.text: Native Americans in the United States and the First Nations of Canada had established varying levels of governmental organization before contact with Europeans; in many cases, these were equivalent to contemporary European levels of government organization.

cell.html: All the native peoples were eventually incorporated into the United States and Canada , but many retain various levels of self-government and autonomy within those two nations.
cell.text: All the native peoples were eventually incorporated into the United States and Canada , but many retain various levels of self-government and autonomy within those two nations.
Cahokia
Illinois , Missouri

cell.html: The population of the town at Cahokia exploded circa 1050 AD, indicating the establishment of a large "chiefdom"
cell.text: The population of the town at Cahokia exploded circa 1050 AD, indicating the establishment of a large "chiefdom"

cell.html: The population of Cahokia dispersed in the 14th Century , indicating the decline of the Cahokia chiefdom
cell.text: The population of Cahokia dispersed in the 14th Century , indicating the decline of the Cahokia chiefdom

cell.html: Other political bodies existed in the Mississippian culture ; the Mississippian culture article has a list of Known Mississippian Chiefdoms
cell.text: Other political bodies existed in the Mississippian culture ; the Mississippian culture article has a list of Known Mississippian Chiefdoms
Iroquois Confederacy
Upstate New York and surrounding areas.

cell.html: Formed before European contact; arguably as early as 31 August 1142 , though also likely sometime in the 15th to the 17th Century
cell.text: Formed before European contact; arguably as early as 31 August 1142 , though also likely sometime in the 15th to the 17th Century

cell.html: The Treaty of Canandaigua , signed in 1794 , established relations between the United States government and the Iroquois; the treaty is still in force, though the Confederacy is no longer effectively an independent nation.
cell.text: The Treaty of Canandaigua , signed in 1794 , established relations between the United States government and the Iroquois; the treaty is still in force, though the Confederacy is no longer effectively an independent nation.
Cherokee Nation

cell.html: Originally in the southeastern United States , primarily Georgia , South Carolina , and North Carolina . Part of the nation (and its government structures) ended up in present-day Oklahoma .
cell.text: Originally in the southeastern United States , primarily Georgia , South Carolina , and North Carolina . Part of the nation (and its government structures) ended up in present-day Oklahoma .

cell.html: The Cherokee nation was unified from an interrelated society of city-states in the early 18th century under the "Emperor" Moytoy
cell.text: The Cherokee nation was unified from an interrelated society of city-states in the early 18th century under the "Emperor" Moytoy

cell.html: The Cherokee Nation and several smaller nations which broke off are still federally recognized tribal entities, somewhat autonomous within the United States, but having similar powers to states.
cell.text: The Cherokee Nation and several smaller nations which broke off are still federally recognized tribal entities, somewhat autonomous within the United States, but having similar powers to states.
Vermont Republic
State of Vermont

cell.html: Organized by Ethan Allen and others in 1777 from territory claimed by New York and New Hampshire .
cell.text: Organized by Ethan Allen and others in 1777 from territory claimed by New York and New Hampshire .

cell.html: Admitted as a state to the United States of America in 1791
cell.text: Admitted as a state to the United States of America in 1791

cell.html: Originally known as Republic of New Connecticut , it had the first written national constitution in North America.
cell.text: Originally known as Republic of New Connecticut , it had the first written national constitution in North America.
State of Franklin
Easternmost Tennessee
Seceded from North Carolina 23 August 1784
Voluntarily re-incorporated into North Carolina in 1788

cell.html: Applied for admission to the United States as a separate state. Whether Franklin considered itself independent of the United States is unclear.
cell.text: Applied for admission to the United States as a separate state. Whether Franklin considered itself independent of the United States is unclear.
State of Muskogee
Western Florida , near Tallahassee

cell.html: Creek and Seminole Indians under English adventurer William Augustus Bowles declared independence in 1799 .
cell.text: Creek and Seminole Indians under English adventurer William Augustus Bowles declared independence in 1799 .
Annexed by Spain in 1803 .
West Florida

cell.html: Gulf Coast of the United States , parts of present-day Louisiana , Mississippi , and Alabama .
cell.text: Gulf Coast of the United States , parts of present-day Louisiana , Mississippi , and Alabama .
Rebelled and declared independence on 3 September 1810 .

cell.html: The Republic lasted only 90 days. Formal reannexation was complete by 10 December 1810 .
cell.text: The Republic lasted only 90 days. Formal reannexation was complete by 10 December 1810 .

cell.html: Applied for admission to the United States as a separate state, but the U.S. refused to recognize it as such.
cell.text: Applied for admission to the United States as a separate state, but the U.S. refused to recognize it as such.
Republic of Indian Stream
Pittsburg, New Hampshire

cell.html: Formed 9 July 1832 in territory claimed by both the United States and Great Britain, where the treaty description of the border was unclear.
cell.text: Formed 9 July 1832 in territory claimed by both the United States and Great Britain, where the treaty description of the border was unclear.

cell.html: Voted to annex to the United States in 1835 , Britain relinquished claim in January 1836, and U.S. jurisdiction was acknowledged around May 1836.
cell.text: Voted to annex to the United States in 1835 , Britain relinquished claim in January 1836, and U.S. jurisdiction was acknowledged around May 1836.
Republic of Texas
Texas and some surrounding territory.
Seceded from Mexico in 1836 .

cell.html: Voluntarily annexed to the United States of America and admitted as a state in 1845.
cell.text: Voluntarily annexed to the United States of America and admitted as a state in 1845.

cell.html: Annexation to the U.S. triggered the Mexican-American War
cell.text: Annexation to the U.S. triggered the Mexican-American War
Republic of the Rio Grande

cell.html: Mexican states of Coahuila , Nuevo León , and Tamaulipas withdrew from Mexico on 17 January 1840
cell.text: Mexican states of Coahuila , Nuevo León , and Tamaulipas withdrew from Mexico on 17 January 1840

cell.html: General Canales, commander of the forces of the Republic of the Rio Grande, accepted a command in the Mexican Army on 6 November 1840 .
cell.text: General Canales, commander of the forces of the Republic of the Rio Grande, accepted a command in the Mexican Army on 6 November 1840 .

cell.html: The Republic of the Rio Grande claimed territory north to the Nueces River and the upper Medina River , territory also claimed by the Republic of Texas
cell.text: The Republic of the Rio Grande claimed territory north to the Nueces River and the upper Medina River , territory also claimed by the Republic of Texas
California Republic
California

cell.html: American settlers declared independence from Mexico in June 1846 .
cell.text: American settlers declared independence from Mexico in June 1846 .

cell.html: Claimed by U.S. Navy for the United States of America in July 1846, and admitted as a state in 1850 .
cell.text: Claimed by U.S. Navy for the United States of America in July 1846, and admitted as a state in 1850 .
Alta California
Southern California

cell.html: After U.S. occupation of Los Angeles in 1846, the Californios revolted and defeated an American force on 30 September 1846 , and organized a government and an army.
cell.text: After U.S. occupation of Los Angeles in 1846, the Californios revolted and defeated an American force on 30 September 1846 , and organized a government and an army.

cell.html: Signed the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo accepting American sovereignty over California on 2 February 1848 .
cell.text: Signed the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo accepting American sovereignty over California on 2 February 1848 .

cell.html: By November 1846, the Californios had gained back control of all the territory south of San Francisco, leaving America in control of just San Diego and Monterey. [1]
cell.text: By November 1846, the Californios had gained back control of all the territory south of San Francisco, leaving America in control of just San Diego and Monterey. [1]
Confederate States of America

cell.html: Southeastern United States of America , from Texas to Virginia .
cell.text: Southeastern United States of America , from Texas to Virginia .

cell.html: Seceded from United States of America in 1861 .
cell.text: Seceded from United States of America in 1861 .

cell.html: Surrendered to United States of America in 1865 .
cell.text: Surrendered to United States of America in 1865 .

cell.html: South Carolina was the first state to secede.
cell.text: South Carolina was the first state to secede.
Republic of Manitoba
Manitoba

cell.html: Founded in June 1867 by Thomas Spence at the town of Portage la Prairie in Rupert's Land
cell.text: Founded in June 1867 by Thomas Spence at the town of Portage la Prairie in Rupert's Land

cell.html: By late spring 1868, the Republic had been informed by the Colonial Office in London that its government had no power. The Province of Manitoba was organized within Canada on 12 May 1870
cell.text: By late spring 1868, the Republic had been informed by the Colonial Office in London that its government had no power. The Province of Manitoba was organized within Canada on 12 May 1870
Dominion of Newfoundland
Newfoundland and Labrador

cell.html: A former Crown Colony which had rejected confederation with Canada in 1869, the Dominion of Newfoundland was established on 26 September 1907 .
cell.text: A former Crown Colony which had rejected confederation with Canada in 1869, the Dominion of Newfoundland was established on 26 September 1907 .

cell.html: Newfoundland entered into confederation with Canada on 31 March 1949 , becoming a province.
cell.text: Newfoundland entered into confederation with Canada on 31 March 1949 , becoming a province.

cell.html: In 1934 , Newfoundland voluntarily gave up self-government and reverted to direct control from London.
cell.text: In 1934 , Newfoundland voluntarily gave up self-government and reverted to direct control from London.

context.text: List of extinct states - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Note: This list includes only nations which formerly existed within the current United States and Canada ; for nations in present-day Mexico and Central America , see above at Pre-Columbian America and below at Mexico and Central America .
See also: :Category:Former countries in North America

In other former Comecon countries Hungarian Soviet Republic Slovak Soviet Republic Kingdom of Yugoslavia (formerly Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes), not to be confused with Communist Yugoslavia. Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia , gradually dismembered In and around what is now Spain and Portugal Couto Mixto

For the hundreds of feudal states of various size (mainly Kleinstaaterei ) and nature that were part of the non-centralised Holy Roman Empire (mainly in Germany, Austria, Benelux countries and various neighbouring regions), see List of states in the Holy Roman Empire
[ edit ] States and territories grouped by geographical location
See List of Indigenous Australian group names
[ edit ] Pre-colonial Africa See also: List of Great Lakes kingdoms and East African City-States

Formal reannexation was complete by 10 December 1810.Applied for admission to the United States as a separate state, but the U.S. refused to recognize it as such.
Republic of Indian StreamPittsburg, New HampshireFormed 9 July 1832 in territory claimed by both the United States and Great Britain, where the treaty description of the border was unclear.Voted to annex to the United States in 1835, Britain relinquished claim in January 1836, and U.S. jurisdiction was acknowledged around May 1836.
Republic of TexasTexas and some surrounding territory.Seceded from Mexico in 1836.Voluntarily annexed to the United States of America and admitted as a state in 1845.Annexation to the U.S. triggered the Mexican-American War
Republic of the Rio GrandeMexican states of Coahuila, Nuevo León, and Tamaulipas withdrew from Mexico on 17 January 1840General Canales, commander of the forces of the Republic of the Rio Grande, accepted a command in the Mexican Army on 6 November 1840.The Republic of the Rio Grande claimed territory north to the Nueces River and the upper Medina River, territory also claimed by the Republic of Texas

Alta CaliforniaSouthern CaliforniaAfter U.S. occupation of Los Angeles in 1846, the Californios revolted and defeated an American force on 30 September 1846, and organized a government and an army.Signed the Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo accepting American sovereignty over California on 2 February 1848.By November 1846, the Californios had gained back control of all the territory south of San Francisco, leaving America in control of just San Diego and Monterey.[1]
Confederate States of AmericaSoutheastern United States of America, from Texas to Virginia.Seceded from United States of America in 1861.Surrendered to United States of America in 1865.South Carolina was the first state to secede.
Republic of ManitobaManitobaFounded in June 1867 by Thomas Spence at the town of Portage la Prairie in Rupert's LandBy late spring 1868, the Republic had been informed by the Colonial Office in London that its government had no power. The Province of Manitoba was organized within Canada on 12 May 1870
